results.title: Cape fear (1991) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Cappa Films, Tribeca Productions, Barbara de Fina and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Master filmmaker Scorcese tackled the re-make of the original 1962 classic with resounding success. Cape Fear is more than a journey towards terror and death. Fourteen years after being imprisoned, vicious psychopath Cady, played chillingly by Robert De Niro, emerges with a single-minded mission: to seek revenge on his attorney Sam Bowden, (Nick Nolte). His purpose, to upset the fragile equilibrium of Sam’s family life with his wife, (Jessica Lange), and teenage daughter, (Juliette Lewis), escalates until their very lives are threatened. Ultimately, Sam has to resort to unorthodox measures, but cannot escape the ultimate showdown in the murky, stormy waters of Cape Fear. Visually stunning images, and brilliant performances, plus cameo roles from original cast members (Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam) highlight this roller-coaster ride through relentless psychological torment. Screenplay Wesley Strick, based on the screenplay by James R. Webb on the novel ‘The Executioners’ by John D. Macdonald. Bernard Herrmann’s original score has been adapted, arranged and conducted by Elmer Bernstein. Edited by Thelma Schoonmaker. Cinematography by Freddie Francis. Credits by Elaine and Saul Bass.

results.title: Cape Fear (1962) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal International Pictures, Sy Bartlett and J Thompson
results.brief_description: Harrowing screen adaptation of John D. MacDonald’s novel ‘The Executioners’. Robert Mitchum is cast as the sadistic Max Cady, who has recently been released from prison and is determined to seek revenge on the lawyer who testified against him in a rape trial. Gregory Peck plays the targeted Savannah lawyer, Sam Bowden whose actions gradually spiral towards violence once Cady begins to harass his wife (Polly Bergen) and teenage daughter (Lori Martin). Unable to restrain Cady using legal methods, Bowden lures him to a remote location where he is free to confront him on equal terms. Cast includes: Martin Balsam, Jack Kruschen, Telly Savalas and Barrie Chase. Cinematography by Samuel Leavitt. Music by Bernard Herrmann. Screenplay by James R. Webb.

results.title: Candleshoe
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller and Norman Tokar
results.brief_description: An adventure story about a noble lady and her orphans fighting to remain in their mansion after being threatened with eviction if the estate taxes are not paid. Lady St Edmund (Helen Hayes), aware of the legend about one of her ancestors supposedly having hidden a treasure of gold coins somewhere in the mansion, unwittingly finds herself a victim of a set-up by two unscrupulous characters, Bundage (Leo McKern) and Grimsworthy (Vivian Pickles), who also want to find the hidden money. Plotting and scheming the pair persuade a young urchin Casey (Jodie Foster), to help them by posing as Lady St Edmund’s long-lost granddaughter. Features David Niven as Priory, Lady St Edmund’s butler, gardener, chauffeur and right-hand man.

results.title: Camille Claudel
results.brief_description: Artistic genius and the descent into madness are at the centre of this stunning drama about Camille Claudel. An independent woman, she ventured into the male dominated sphere of sculpture in the 1880’s and left an indelible mark on the genre. After achieving an apprenticeship to renowned sculptor, Auguste Rodin (24 years older than she), and reaching a level of intimacy with him, she longs for more. His refusal initiates a decline in their relationship and her sanity. Based upon the biography of Camille Claudel by Rein-Marie Paris, great niece of Camille, this hauntingly dark and brooding film will sweep its audience along the raging torrent that was Camille Claudel’s life. Stars Gerard Depardieu and Isabelle Adjani. English subtitles with French dialogue.

results.title: Camille
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Turner Entertainment and George Cukor
results.brief_description: Her beauty is the stuff of Hollywood legends, her voice pure magic. Screen legend, Greta Garbo is captured at the very summit of her career. In one of the most romantic tales ever put on film, Garbo is breathtaking as the doomed courtesan whose passion for romance is equalled only by her passion for life. From her first appearance in the luxurious carriage that sweeps her off to the opera, to her last gasp in the arms of her broken hearted lover, Garbo’s performance makes an indelible impression. As Armand Duval, her ardent suitor, Robert Taylor cuts a striking figure that makes the futility of his love all the more poignant. The supporting roles are similarly cast with uncanny accuracy. Lionel Barrymore is commanding as Armand’s well-meaning father; Henry Daniell chills one’s blood with his sadistic portrayal of the Baron de Varville.

results.title: Camelot
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jack L. Warner and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: Adapted from the very successful Broadway show, “Camelot” features songs from the renowned songwriting team of Lerner and Loewe. Starring Richard Harris, Vanessa Redgrave, Franco Nero, David Hemmings and Lionel Jeffries, it tells of the tragic romantic triangle between Arthur, Guinevere and Sir Lancelot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros Pictures, Jack L. Warner and Joshua Logan

results.title: Came a hot friday
results.creator_credit: Mirage Films, Challenge Film Corporation, Larry Parr and Ian Mune
results.brief_description: It is 1949. The privations of war are over and there is money to be made! Two conmen have been successfully cheating bookies at racetracks across the United States. When they stop at a small town called Tainuia Junction, their luck runs out. After waging a war with the local police and the owner of the town casino, they enlist the aid of the Tainuia Kid, a Zorro nut and the wildest comic ever to ride the ranges. It is the bad guys versus the not-so-bad guys in this off-the-wall comedy that takes the viewer on a rollercoaster of laughs against a backdrop of horseracing, gambling, fast cars and loose women. Starring Billy T. James, Peter Bland, Phillip Gordon and Marshall Napier. Based on the novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson.

results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Massfilms, CCC Filmkunst, Izaro Films, Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Universal Pictures France, Towers of London (Films), Harry Allen Towers, Arthur Brauner and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description: One of a plethora of adaptations for the big and small screen of Jack London’s famous novel, this 1972 film version of “Call of the wild” features Charlton Heston as Jack Thornton, a kindly would-be prospector heading for the 1897 Klondike gold rush, who adopts a mistreated dog. The man and the animal strike up a unique friendship as they travel through the wilderness. This family orientated film was a multi-national production filmed on location in Norway. The voices of non-English speaking actors were dubbed into English. Cast also includes Michele Mercier, George Eastman and Maria Rohm.

results.title: California suite
results.creator_credit: Columbia Films, Ray Stark and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Five couples find themselves in a Beverley Hills hotel during the week of the Oscars. Four stories blend with an all star cast and the slick writing style of Neil Simon, to produce a comedy about human behaviour in all its variety. Maggie Smith won the Oscar for this 1970’s comedy which made the transition from the New York Stage to the big screen. Also stars: Jane Fonda, Alan Alda, Michael Caine, Walter Matthau, Elaine May, Herb Edelman, Denise Galik, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Gloria Gifford and Sheila Frazier.

results.title: Calamity Jane (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, William Jacobs and David Butler
results.brief_description: The Wild West in a spectacular musical with Doris Day as Calamity Jane and Howard Keel as Wild Bill Hickcock. Calamity Jane arrives from the “Windy city” after finding a star attraction for the local saloon. As she is taken by the “Deadwood Stage” to the “Black hills of Dakota”, she meets Wild Bill Hickock, her “Secret love”.
